Honeysuckle Red Drink Punch Recipe | Bon Appétit

It’s a blend of sugar, citric acid, and powdered dried strawberries and cherries. “It’s a natural version of Kool-Aid,” he says of the tangy-sweet booze-free beverage. “I serve it to my pop-up dinner guests in individual powder packets to stir for themselves as an exercise in destigmatizing Black food traditions.”Ingredients8–10 Servings2oz. freeze-dried strawberries   (about 3 cups)1.25 oz. freeze-dried cherries (about 1 cup)1cup sugar1Tbsp. plus 1½ tsp. citric acidPinch of kosher saltPreparationStep 1Process strawberries, cherries, sugar, citric acid, and salt in a food processor until finely ground, about 1 minute.Step 2Pour 10 cups water into a large pot  or bowl. Whisking constantly, sprinkle  in powder; whisk until sugar dissolves, about 2 minutes. Strain into a pitcher.Step 3Pour into ice-filled glasses to serve.Step 4Do ahead: Powder can be made  1 month ahead. Store airtight at room temperature.How would you rate Honeysuckle Red Drink Punch?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (3)Back to TopTriangleSo sour!HarrisonSacramento, Ca11/23/2020As soon as I read this article in the magazine, I knew I had to make this drink. I love Kool-aid but never drink it anymore because it's basically colored sugar water. The recipe seemed a bit complicated because of needing to strain it but it's well worth the effort to remove the seeds. But, this is no Kool-aid. It is sooo much better. It's more like a delicious, fresh tasting Hawaiian Punch, without the corn syrup and artificial additives. I will be making this again. I also bought other freeze dried fruits to try different variations. I think this would make a great base for a summer spritzer or a shot of hard stuff like Vodka or Rum if you want to spice it up.

To answer the person below, weigh the powders based on the measurements given. (2oz and 1.25oz) RobbieKPennsylvania6/23/2020I see the freeze dried strawberries & cherries already available as a powder.  Can you say how much powder this would translate to?  It looks amazing!
